page.title: 08Leafield Church.
page.content: Leafield Church is called St. Michael and All Angels'.It was built in 1860 and designed by Sir Gilbert Scott. The church spire is 145.5 feet tall, is an octagon and has a weather cock.The church is 107 feet long.It is built out of local stone and the roof is Stonesfield Slate.The windows are stained glass and there is a rose window to the west.It has an organ, pulpit and a great carving of an eagle on which there is a bible. There are seats for 500 people.The spire was damaged by the weather in 1864. There are six bells.One of them is from Queen Victoria. There is a lych gate that is a war memorial from 1914-18. Sometimes children do plays there and hold festivals. There is a chapel in our village too.
